title: Bug 3666: Code Completion Hungry code assist
description: Bug 3666CodeCompletionHungry code assist (1GDRYW5) jkca (5/15/2001 11:04:56 AM)jresdk 106Under certain circumstances code assist eats too much code.Consider the enclosed class.As a programmer, I must add a parameter to the baz call in bar to make the program correct.Steps:1. UI can decide whether it wants to use the code assist end position (until the end of current identifier) or the cursor location it used to start with, so as to control the amount of source to replace. Removing code assist option. KUM (5/21/01 9:02:11 AM)The text to replace is computed by the code assist infrastructure.Moved to ITPJCORE.PM (9/4/2001 2:58:56 PM)Option was added.PM (9/25/2001 2:20:50 PM)Removing option.
EB: The code assist feature should only replace the necessary code and not consume additional code. In the given example, when calling the 'baz' method in the 'bar' method, it should only replace 'x.foo()' and not the entire 'x.foo().foo()' expression.
SR:
1. Open the software.
2. Create a class similar to the provided example.
3. Inside the 'bar' method, call the 'baz' method and provide arguments.
4. Observe that the code assist feature replaces more code than necessary, consuming additional code.
